section.title: Expansions in Series of Ferrers Functions

para.sentence: \mathsf{Ps}^{m}_{n}\left(x,\gamma^{2}\right)=\sum_{k=-R}^{\infty}(-1)^{k}a^{m} _{n,k}(\gamma^{2})\mathsf{P}^{m}_{n+2k}\left(x\right), where \mathsf{P}^{m}_{n+2k}\left(x\right) is the Ferrers function of the first kind (ยง14.3(i)),

R=\left\lfloor\frac{1}{2}(n-m)\right\rfloor , and the coefficients a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2}) are given by a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2})=(-1)^{k}\left(n+2k+\tfrac{1}{2}\right)\frac{(n-m+2k)!} {(n+m+2k)!}\*\int_{-1}^{1}\mathsf{Ps}^{m}_{n}\left(x,\gamma^{2}\right)\mathsf{ P}^{m}_{n+2k}\left(x\right)\mathrm{d}x.

Then the set of coefficients a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2}) , k=-R,-R+1,-R+2,\dots is the solution of the difference equation A_{k}f_{k-1}+\left(B_{k}-\lambda^{m}_{n}\left(\gamma^{2}\right)\right)f_{k}+C_ {k}f_{k+1}=0, (note that A_{-R}=0 ) that satisfies the normalizing condition \sum_{k=-R}^{\infty}a_{n,k}^{m}(\gamma^{2})a_{n,k}^{-m}(\gamma^{2})\frac{1}{2n +4k+1}=\frac{1}{2n+1}, with a_{n,k}^{-m}(\gamma^{2})=\frac{(n-m)!(n+m+2k)!}{(n+m)!(n-m+2k)!}a_{n,k}^{m}( \gamma^{2}).

\mathsf{Qs}^{m}_{n}\left(x,\gamma^{2}\right)=\sum_{k=-\infty}^{-N-1}(-1)^{k}{a ^{\prime}}^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2})\mathsf{P}^{m}_{n+2k}\left(x\right)+\sum_{k=-N }^{\infty}(-1)^{k}a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2})\mathsf{Q}^{m}_{n+2k}\left(x\right), where \mathsf{P}^{m}_{n} and \mathsf{Q}^{m}_{n} are again the Ferrers functions and N=\left\lfloor\frac{1}{2}(n+m)\right\rfloor.
The coefficients a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2}) satisfy (30.8.4) for all k when we set a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2})=0 for k<-N.
For k\geq-R they agree with the coefficients defined in ยง30.8(i).
For k=-N,-N+1,\dots,-R-1 they are determined from (30.8.4) by forward recursion using a^{m}_{n,-N-1}(\gamma^{2})=0.

The set of coefficients {a^{\prime}}^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2}) , k=-N-1,-N-2,\dots , is the recessive solution of (30.8.4) as k\to-\infty that is normalized by A_{-N-1}{a^{\prime}}^{m}_{n,-N-2}(\gamma^{2})+{\left(B_{-N-1}-\lambda^{m}_{n} \left(\gamma^{2}\right)\right){a^{\prime}}^{m}_{n,-N-1}(\gamma^{2})}+C^{\prime }a^{m}_{n,-N}(\gamma^{2})=0, with C^{\prime}=\begin{cases}\dfrac{\gamma^{2}}{4m^{2}-1},&\mbox{$n-m$ even},\\ -\dfrac{\gamma^{2}}{(2m-1)(2m-3)},&\mbox{$n-m$ odd}.\end{cases } It should be noted that if the forward recursion (30.8.4) beginning with f_{-N-1}=0 , f_{-N}=1 leads to f_{-R}=0 , then a^{m}_{n,k}(\gamma^{2}) is undefined for n<-R and \mathsf{Qs}^{m}_{n}\left(x,\gamma^{2}\right) does not exist.
